meanings.definition: relating to or characteristic of an anthology
meanings.sent1: The teacher assigned an anthological project where students had to create their own story collection.
meanings.sent2: The library displayed an anthological exhibit featuring various short stories from different authors.
meanings.sent3: It was quite anthological to see all the different genres mixed together in one book.
meanings.sent4: Her room looked anthological, with shelves filled with books of all shapes and sizes.
meanings.sent5: The anthological nature of the event made it a memorable experience for all attendees.

meanings.definition: consisting of a collection of literary works or passages
meanings.sent1: The museum showcased an anthological display of ancient manuscripts and scrolls.
meanings.sent2: The anthology was anthological, containing poems, essays, and short stories from various authors.
meanings.sent3: It seemed anthological that all the best works were gathered in one place for the competition.
meanings.sent4: The bookstore had an anthological atmosphere, with shelves filled with literary treasures.
meanings.sent5: The anthological collection of plays highlighted the diversity of the playwright's talent.
